bibl.idno: The Papers of Henry Rose Carter [manuscript] ; HEALTHSCI MS-10.

bibl.title: Letter from Ronald Ross to Henry Rose Carter, July 12, 1915

div1.p: Ross acknowledges receiving Carter's paper on the effect of impounded water on malaria.

div1.head: Letter from Ronald Ross to Henry Rose Carter, July 12, 1915
div1.opener:
FROM
SIR RONALD ROSS, K.C.B., F.R.S
TELEPHONE & TELEGRAMS
8328 MAYFAIR.
18, CAVENDISH SQUARE,
LONDON, W.
12th July, 1915.
Senior Surgeon H. R. Carter, M.D.,
Public Health and Marine Hospital Service,
Treasury Department, Baltimore, U.S.A.
Dear Dr. Carter,
div1.p:
I have just received your excellent and philosophical
paper on the effect of impounded water on malaria, and write
merely to acknowledge it and to tell you that I am ordered off
to the war in the Dardanelles owing to the oubreak of certain
fever there. Please accept my kind regards and good wishes
for the future.
